did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Social Work Archives Oral History Collection
did.abstract: Oral history interviews with important figures in the field of social work. Audio tapes and transcriptions available for most interviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
This collection includes oral history interviews with important figures in the field of social work, conducted circa 1970-1998. Many were conducted by Vida S. Grayson. Subjects include:
Dorothy C. Bailey, transcript (114p)
Louise S. Bandler, transcript (448p), 14 audiotapes. [Louise Bandler Papers are closed]
Merriall Boselli, transcript (71p)
Dorcas Bowles, transcript and audiotape
Eleanor Clark, transcript (352p), eleven audiotapes (restricted)
Esther Cook, transcript (55p), audiotape
Rose Dawson, transcript (71p), audiotape
Ann Hartman (in Ann Hartman Papers)
Irving Kaufman, transcript (132p)
Jean Leach, transcript (320p)
[See also Jean Leach Papers]
Roger Miller, transcript (294 p)
Grace Nicholls, transcript (255p)
Howard Parad, transcript (249p) and audiotape [closed]
Bertha C. Reynolds, transcript (58p) and three audiotapes
[see also Bertha Capen Reynolds Papers]
Nancy Staver, transcript (274p) and ten audiotapes
[see also Nancy Staver Papers]
Fanny Tollennar, transcript (43p)

In addition, see the following oral histories in other collections:
Florence Hollis
[in Florence Hollis and Rosemary Reynolds Papers]
Elmina Lucke
[in Elmina Lucke Papers]
Rosemary Reynolds
[in Florence Hollis and Rosemary Reynolds Papers]
NOTE: The container list for this collection is available in the Sophia Smith Collection. Please contact us to request a copy.

accessrestrict.p: The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection.
Partially restricted access - contact the Sophia Smith Collection for more information.

userestrict.p: Copyright to unpublished materials may be owned by the creator, or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights. Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must also be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Social Work Archives Oral History Collection, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this record.

controlaccess.head: Search Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Smith College School for Social Work--History--Sources
controlaccess.subject: Social workers--United States--History--Sources
Oral history--Archival resources

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For more collections relating to the history of Social Work, see the guide to the Smith College Social Work Archives.

Additional oral histories are included in papers of social workers Ann Hartman, Florence Hollis and Rosemary Reynolds, Elmina Rose Lucke, and Bertha Capen Reynolds, which are all part of the Social Work Archives.
